effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Evolves a male kirlia into gallade or a female snorunt into froslass.
name: dawn-stone
text: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It sparkles like eyes.

effect: Held by Seadra: Evolves the holder into Kingdra when traded.
name: dragon-scale
text: A thick and tough scale. Dragon-type Pokémon may be holding this item when caught.

effect: Held by Porygon2: Evolves the holder into Porygon-Z when traded.
name: dubious-disc
text: A transparent device overflowing with dubious data. Its producer is unknown.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Evolves a lampent into chandelure, a misdreavus into mismagius, or a murkrow into honchkrow.
name: dusk-stone
text: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It is as dark as dark can be.

effect: Held by Electabuzz: Evolves the holder into Electivire when traded.
name: electirizer
text: A box packed with a tremendous amount of electric energy. It is loved by a certain Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Evolves an eevee into flareon, a growlithe into arcanine, a pansear into simisear, or a vulpix into ninetales.
name: fire-stone
text: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It is colored orange.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Evolves an Alola sandshrew into Alola sandslash or an Alola vulpix into Alola ninetales.
name: ice-stone
text: A peculiar stone that can make certain species of Pokémon evolve. It has an unmistakable snowflake pattern.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Evolves an exeggcute into exeggutor, a gloom into vileplume, a nuzleaf into shiftry, a pansage into simisage, or a weepinbell into victreebel.
name: leaf-stone
text: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It has a leaf pattern.

effect: Held by Magmar: Evolves the holder into Magmortar when traded.
name: magmarizer
text: A box packed with a tremendous amount of magma energy. It is loved by a certain Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Evolves a clefairy into clefable, a jigglypuff into wigglytuff, a munna into musharna, a nidorina into nidoqueen, a nidorino into nidoking, or a skitty into delcatty.
name: moon-stone
text: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It is as black as the night sky.

effect: Held by happiny : Holder evolves into chansey when it levels up during the daytime.
name: oval-stone
text: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It is shaped like an egg.

effect: Held by feebas : Holder evolves into milotic when traded.
name: prism-scale
text: A mysterious scale that evolves certain Pokémon. It shines in rainbow colors.

effect: Held by Rhydon: Evolves the holder into Rhyperior when traded.
name: protector
text: A protective item of some sort. It is extremely stiff and heavy. It is loved by a certain Pokémon.

effect: Held by Dusclops: Evolves the holder into Dusknoir when traded.
name: reaper-cloth
text: A cloth imbued with horrifyingly strong spiritual energy. It is loved by a certain Pokémon.

effect: Traded on a Spritzee: Holder evolves into Aromatisse.
name: sachet
text: A sachet filled with fragrant perfumes that are just slightly too overwhelming. Yet it's loved by a certain Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Evolves a minccino into cinccino, a roselia into roserade, or a togetic into togekiss.
name: shiny-stone
text: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It shines with a dazzling light.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Evolves a cottonee into whimsicott, a gloom into bellossom, a petilil into lilligant, or a sunkern into sunflora.
name: sun-stone
text: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It is as red as the sun.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Evolves an eelektrik into eelektross, an eevee into jolteon, or a pikachu into raichu.
name: thunder-stone
text: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It has a thunderbolt pattern.

effect: Held by Porygon: Evolves the holder into Porygon2 when traded.
name: up-grade
text: A transparent device filled with all sorts of data. It was produced by Silph Co.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Evolves an eevee into vaporeon, a lombre into ludicolo, a panpour into simipour, a poliwhirl into poliwrath, a shellder into cloyster, or a staryu into starmie.
name: water-stone
text: A peculiar stone that makes certain species of Pokémon evolve. It is a clear, light blue.

effect: Traded on a Swirlix: Holder evolves into Slurpuff.
name: whipped-dream
text: A soft and sweet treat made of fluffy, puffy, whipped and whirled cream. It's loved by a certain Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Restores 20 HP.
name: berry-juice
text: A 100% pure juice made of Berries. It restores the HP of one Pokémon by just 20 points.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Restores 50 HP. Decreases happiness by 5/5/10.
name: energy-powder
text: A very bitter medicine powder. It restores the HP of one Pokémon by 50 points.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Restores 200 HP. Decreases happiness by 10/10/15.
name: energy-root
text: A very bitter root. It restores the HP of one Pokémon by 200 points.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Restores 50 HP.
name: fresh-water
text: Water with a high mineral content. It restores the HP of one Pokémon by 50 points.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Restores HP to full and cures any status ailment and confusion.
name: full-restore
text: A medicine that fully restores the HP and heals any status problems of a single Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Restores 200 HP.
name: hyper-potion
text: A spray-type medicine for wounds. It restores the HP of one Pokémon by 200 points.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Restores 80 HP.
name: lemonade
text: A very sweet drink. It restores the HP of one Pokémon by 80 points.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Restores HP to full.
name: max-potion
text: A spray-type medicine for wounds. It completely restores the HP of a single Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Restores 100 HP.
name: moomoo-milk
text: Milk with a very high nutrition content. It restores the HP of one Pokémon by 100 points.

effect: Used on a friendly Pokémon : Restores 20 HP.
name: potion
text: A spray-type medicine for wounds. It restores the HP of one Pokémon by just 20 points.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Restores 60 HP.
name: soda-pop
text: A fizzy soda drink. It restores the HP of one Pokémon by 60 points.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Restores 50 HP.
name: super-potion
text: A spray-type medicine for wounds. It restores the HP of one Pokémon by 50 points.

effect: Used on a friendly Pokémon : Restores 20 HP.
name: sweet-heart
text: Very sweet chocolate. It restores the HP of one Pokémon by only 20 points.

effect: Held in battle : When the holder is frozen, it consumes this item to thaw itself. Used on a party Pokémon : Cures freezing.
name: aspear-berry
text: It may be used or held by a Pokémon to defrost it.

effect: Held in battle : When the holder is paralyzed, it consumes this item to cure the paralysis. Used on a party Pokémon : Cures paralysis.
name: cheri-berry
text: It may be used or held by a Pokémon to recover from paralysis.

effect: Held in battle : When the holder is asleep, it consumes this item to wake up. Used on a party Pokémon : Cures sleep.
name: chesto-berry
text: It may be used or held by a Pokémon to recover from sleep.

effect: Held in battle : When the holder is out of PP for one of its moves, it consumes this item to restore 10 of that move's PP. Used on a party Pokémon : Restores 10 PP for a selected move.
name: leppa-berry
text: It may be used or held by a Pokémon to restore a move's PP by 10.

effect: Held in battle : When the holder is afflicted with a major status ailment, it consumes this item to cure the ailment. Used on a party Pokémon : Cures any major status ailment.
name: lum-berry
text: It may be used or held by a Pokémon to recover from any status problem.

effect: Held in battle : When the holder has 1/2 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to restore 10 HP. Used on a party Pokémon : Restores 10 HP.
name: oran-berry
text: It may be used or held by a Pokémon to heal the user by just 10 HP.

effect: Held in battle : When the holder is poisoned, it consumes this item to cure the poison. Used on a party Pokémon : Cures poison.
name: pecha-berry
text: It may be used or held by a Pokémon to recover from poison.

effect: Held in battle : When the holder is confused, it consumes this item to cure the confusion. Used on a party Pokémon : Cures confusion.
name: persim-berry
text: It may be used or held by a Pokémon to recover from confusion.

effect: Held in battle : When the holder is burned, it consumes this item to cure the burn. Used on a party Pokémon : Cures a burn.
name: rawst-berry
text: It may be used or held by a Pokémon to recover from a burn.

effect: Held in battle : When the holder has 1/2 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to restore 1/4 its max HP. Used on a party Pokémon : Restores 1/4 the Pokémon's max HP.
name: sitrus-berry
text: It may be used or held by a Pokémon to heal the user's HP a little.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Restores 10 PP for each move.
name: elixir
text: It restores the PP of all the moves learned by the targeted Pokémon by 10 points each.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Restores 10 PP for a selected move.
name: ether
text: It restores the PP of a Pokémon's selected move by a maximum of 10 points.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Restores PP to full for each move.
name: max-elixir
text: It fully restores the PP of all the moves learned by the targeted Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Restores PP to full for a selected move.
name: max-ether
text: It fully restores the PP of a single selected move that has been learned by the target Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Revives the Pokémon and restores its HP to full.
name: max-revive
text: A medicine that revives a fainted Pokémon. It fully restores the Pokémon's HP.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Revives a fainted Pokémon and restores its HP to full. Decreases happiness by 10/10/15.
name: revival-herb
text: A very bitter medicinal herb. It revives a fainted Pokémon, fully restoring its HP.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Revives the Pokémon and restores half its HP.
name: revive
text: A medicine that revives a fainted Pokémon. It restores half the Pokémon’s maximum HP.

effect: Used : Revives all fainted Pokémon in the party and restores their HP to full.
name: sacred-ash
text: It revives all fainted Pokémon. In doing so, it also fully restores their HP.

effect: Used in battle : Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon. If the wild Pokémon is an Ultra Beast, this ball has a catch rate of 5x. Otherwise, it has a catch rate of 0.1x. If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
name: beast-ball
text: A special Poké Ball designed to catch Ultra Beasts. It has a low success rate for catching others.

effect: Used in battle : Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1x. If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
name: cherish-ball
text: A quite rare Poké Ball that has been specially crafted to commemorate an occasion of some sort.

effect: Used in battle : Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon. If the wild Pokémon was encountered by surfing or fishing, this ball has a catch rate of 3.5x. Otherwise, it has a catch rate of 1x. If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
name: dive-ball
text: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on Pokémon that live in the sea.

effect: Can only be used in Entree Forest, to catch Pokémon encountered in the Dream World. Used in battle : Catches a wild Pokémon without fail.
name: dream-ball
text: A special Poké Ball that appears out of nowhere in a bag at the Entree Forest. It can catch any Pokémon.

effect: Used in battle : Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon. If it's currently nighttime or the wild Pokémon was encountered while walking in a cave, this ball has a catch rate of 3.5x. Otherwise, it has a catch rate of 1x. If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
name: dusk-ball
text: A somewhat different Poké Ball that makes it easier to catch wild Pokémon at night or in dark places like caves.

effect: Used in battle : Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1x. The caught Pokémon's HP is immediately restored, PP for all its moves is restored, and any status ailment is cured. If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
name: heal-ball
text: A remedial Poké Ball that restores the caught Pokémon’s HP and eliminates any status problem.

effect: Used in battle : Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1x. Whenever the caught Pokémon's happiness increases, it increases by one extra point. If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
name: luxury-ball
text: A comfortable Poké Ball that makes a caught wild Pokémon quickly grow friendly.

effect: Used in battle : Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon. Has a catch rate of given by `(40 - level) / 10`, where `level` is the wild Pokémon's level, to a maximum of 3.9x for level 1 Pokémon. If the wild Pokémon's level is higher than 30, this ball has a catch rate of 1x. If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
name: nest-ball
text: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on weaker Pokémon in the wild.

effect: Used in battle : Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon. If the wild Pokémon is water- or bug-type, this ball has a catch rate of 3x. Otherwise, it has a catch rate of 1x. If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
name: net-ball
text: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on Water- and Bug-type Pokémon.

effect: Used in battle : Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1x. If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
name: premier-ball
text: A somewhat rare Poké Ball that has been specially made to commemorate an event of some sort.

effect: Used in battle : Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 4x on the first turn of a battle, but 1x any other time. If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
name: quick-ball
text: A somewhat different Poké Ball that provides a better catch rate if it is used at the start of a wild encounter.

effect: Used in battle : Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon. If the wild Pokémon's species is marked as caught in the trainer's Pokédex, this ball has a catch rate of 3x. Otherwise, it has a catch rate of 1x. If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
name: repeat-ball
text: A somewhat different Poké Ball that works especially well on Pokémon species that were previously caught.

effect: Used in battle : Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon. Has a catch rate of 1.1x on the first turn of the battle and increases by 0.1x every turn, to a maximum of 4x on turn 30. If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
name: timer-ball
text: A somewhat different Ball that becomes progressively better the more turns there are in a battle.

effect: Used outside of battle : Decreases the wild Pokémon encounter rate by 50%.
name: black-flute
text: A black flute made from blown glass. Its melody makes wild Pokémon less likely to appear.

effect: Used outside of battle : Transports the trainer to the last-entered dungeon entrance. Cannot be used outside, in buildings, or in distortion world, sinnoh hall of origin 1, spear pillar, or turnback cave.
name: escape-rope
text: A long, durable rope. Use it to escape instantly from a cave or a dungeon.

effect: Used in battle : Ends a wild battle. Cannot be used in trainer battles.
name: fluffy-tail
text: An item that attracts Pokémon. Use it to flee from any battle with a wild Pokémon.

effect: Used outside of battle : Trainer will skip encounters with wild Pokémon of a lower level than the lead party Pokémon. This effect wears off after the trainer takes 250 steps.
name: max-repel
text: An item that prevents weak wild Pokémon from appearing for 250 steps after its use.

effect: Used in battle : Ends a wild battle. Cannot be used in trainer battles.
name: poke-doll
text: A doll that attracts Pokémon. Use it to flee from any battle with a wild Pokémon.

effect: Used in battle : Ends a wild battle. Cannot be used in trainer battles.
name: poke-toy
text: An item that attracts Pokémon. Use it to flee from any battle with a wild Pokémon.

effect: Used outside of battle : Trainer will skip encounters with wild Pokémon of a lower level than the lead party Pokémon. This effect wears off after the trainer takes 100 steps.
name: repel
text: An item that prevents weak wild Pokémon from appearing for 100 steps after its use.

effect: Used outside of battle : Trainer will skip encounters with wild Pokémon of a lower level than the lead party Pokémon. This effect wears off after the trainer takes 200 steps.
name: super-repel
text: An item that prevents weak wild Pokémon from appearing for 200 steps after its use.

effect: Used outside of battle : Doubles the wild Pokémon encounter rate.
name: white-flute
text: A white flute made from blown glass. Its melody makes wild Pokémon more likely to appear.

effect: Used in battle : Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1.5x. If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
name: great-ball
text: A good, high-performance Ball that provides a higher Pokémon catch rate than a standard Poké Ball.

effect: Used in battle : Catches a wild Pokémon without fail. If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
name: master-ball
text: The best Ball with the ultimate level of performance. It will catch any wild Pokémon without fail.

effect: Used by a trainer in battle : Catches a wild Pokémon. This item can only be used in pal park.
name: park-ball
text: A special Poké Ball for the Pal Park.

effect: Used in battle : Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1x. If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
name: poke-ball
text: A device for catching wild Pokémon. It is thrown like a ball at the target. It is designed as a capsule system.

effect: Used in battle : Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1.5x. This item can only be used in the great marsh or kanto safari zone.
name: safari-ball
text: A special Poké Ball that is used only in the Great Marsh. It is decorated in a camouflage pattern.

effect: Used by a trainer in battle : Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon. The wild Pokémon's catch rate is 1.5x normal.
name: sport-ball
text: A special Poké Ball for the Bug-Catching Contest.

effect: Used in battle : Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 2x. If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.
name: ultra-ball
text: An ultra-performance Ball that provides a higher Pokémon catch rate than a Great Ball.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Cures poison.
name: antidote
text: A spray-type medicine. It lifts the effect of poison from one Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Cures sleep.
name: awakening
text: A spray-type medicine. It awakens a Pokémon from the clutches of sleep.

effect: Cures major status ailments and confusion.
name: big-malasada
text: The Alola region's local specialty—fried bread. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Cures a burn.
name: burn-heal
text: A spray-type medicine. It heals a single Pokémon that is suffering from a burn.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Cures any status ailment and confusion.
name: casteliacone
text: Castelia City's specialty, soft-serve ice cream. It heals all the status problems of a single Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Cures any status ailment and confusion.
name: full-heal
text: A spray-type medicine. It heals all the status problems of a single Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Cures any status ailment. Decreases happiness by 5/5/10.
name: heal-powder
text: A very bitter medicine powder. It heals all the status problems of a single Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Cures freezing.
name: ice-heal
text: A spray-type medicine. It defrosts a Pokémon that has been frozen solid.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Cures any status ailment and confusion.
name: lava-cookie
text: Lavaridge Town's local specialty. It heals all the status problems of one Pokémon.

effect: Cures all major status ailments and confusion.
name: lumiose-galette
text: A popular treat in Lumiose City. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Cures any status ailment and confusion.
name: old-gateau
text: Old Chateau's hidden specialty. It heals all the status problems of a single Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Cures paralysis.
name: paralyze-heal
text: A spray-type medicine. It eliminates paralysis from a single Pokémon.

effect: Cures any major status ailment and confusion.
name: shalour-sable
text: Shalour City’s famous shortbread. It can be used once to heal all the status conditions of a Pokémon.

effect: Switches a Pokémon between its two possible (non-Hidden) Abilities.
name: ability-capsule
text: A capsule that allows a Pokémon with two Abilities to switch between these Abilities when it is used.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Increases Special Attack effort by 10, but won't increase it beyond 100. Increases happiness by 5/3/2.
name: calcium
text: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. It raises the base Sp. Atk (Special Attack) stat of a single Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Increases Speed effort by 10, but won't increase it beyond 100. Increases happiness by 5/3/2.
name: carbos
text: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. It raises the base Speed stat of a single Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Increases the target's Special Defense effort by 1.
name: clever-wing
text: An item for use on a Pokémon. It slightly increases the base Sp. Def stat of a single Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Increases the target's Special Attack effort by 1.
name: genius-wing
text: An item for use on a Pokémon. It slightly increases the base Sp. Atk stat of a single Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Increases the target's HP effort by 1.
name: health-wing
text: An item for use on a Pokémon. It slightly increases the base HP of a single Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Increases HP effort by 10, but won't increase it beyond 100. Increases happiness by 5/3/2.
name: hp-up
text: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. It raises the base HP of a single Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Increases Defense effort by 10, but won't increase it beyond 100. Increases happiness by 5/3/2.
name: iron
text: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. It raises the base Defense stat of a single Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Increases the target's Attack effort by 1.
name: muscle-wing
text: An item for use on a Pokémon. It slightly increases the base Attack stat of a single Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Increases a selected move's max PP to 1.6x its original max PP. Increases happiness by 5/3/2.
name: pp-max
text: It maximally raises the top PP of a selected move that has been learned by the target Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Increases a selected move's max PP by 20% its original max PP, to a maximum of 1.6x. Increases happiness by 5/3/2.
name: pp-up
text: It slightly raises the maximum PP of a selected move that has been learned by the target Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Increases Attack effort by 10, but won't increase it beyond 100. Increases happiness by 5/3/2.
name: protein
text: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. It raises the base Attack stat of a single Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Increases level by 1. Increases happiness by 5/3/2.
name: rare-candy
text: A candy that is packed with energy. It raises the level of a single Pokémon by one.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Increases the target's Defense effort by 1.
name: resist-wing
text: An item for use on a Pokémon. It slightly increases the base Defense stat of a single Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Increases the target's Speed effort by 1.
name: swift-wing
text: An item for use on a Pokémon. It slightly increases the base Speed stat of a single Pokémon.

effect: Used on a party Pokémon : Increases Special Defense effort by 10, but won't increase it beyond 100. Increases happiness by 5/3/2.
name: zinc
text: A nutritious drink for Pokémon. It raises the base Sp. Def (Special Defense) stat of a single Pokémon.
